poem:
**The Ranger's Lament**

In Texas shadows,
a black figure rides the dusk,
Doom heavy on his shoulders,
the drink a murky mirror.
Trump's America,
a chorus of discord,
where justice stumbles,
and Mathews drowns,
seeking solace in the silence
of empty bottles
and the long,
unfurling road.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Crime and thrillers of the month – review It is 2019, Donald Trump is still president, and Attica Locke’s protagonist Darren Mathews, one of the few Black men to be a Texas Ranger, can’t “shake this feeling that something truly awful was coming their way”. Guide Me Home (Viper) is the final instalment of Locke’s excellent Highway 59 series, and things aren’t going well for Darren. He’s drinking heavily – “managing his sense of doom". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
